about.note: The metadata provided herein has been generated using the TFL Designer Enterprise version 1.5.3. The representation of metadata fields available in this worksheet adheres to the CDISC Analysis Results Standard example available on the ARS GitHub repository.

methods.name: Count by group for a categorical variable
methods.description: Count across groups for a categorical variable, based on subject occurrence
methods.label: Grouped count for categorical variable

codeTemplate.code:
in_data = df2_analysisidhere |>
    dplyr::select(anavarhere, groupvar1here) |>
    unique()
df3_analysisidhere <-
  cards::ard_categorical(
    data = in_data
    bystmthere
  ) |>
dplyr::filter(stat_name == 'n') |>
 dplyr::mutate(operationid = 'Mth_01_01_n')

parameters.name: anavarhere
parameters.description: Analysis variable to be summarised

parameters.name: groupvar1here
parameters.description: Analysis grouping variable from Group1

parameters.name: bystmthere
parameters.description: Combined statement for "variables" and "by" statement in ard_categorical

methods.name: Summary by group of a categorical variable

referencedOperationRelationships.description: The count operation whose result provides the numerator for calculation of the percentage. The referenced analysis should be the analysis that contains this percent operation.

The count operation whose result provides the denominator for calculation of the percentage. The referenced analysis should have the same analysis set and subject grouping(s) as the analysis containing this percent operation.

methods.label: Grouped summary of categorical variable
methods.description: Descriptive summary statistics across groups for a categorical variable, based on subject occurrence

codeTemplate.code:
denom_dataset = df2_denomanaidhere |>
                    dplyr::select(denom_anagroupvarshere)

                    in_data = df2_analysisidhere |>
                        dplyr::distinct(distinctlisthere) |>
                        dplyr::mutate(dummy = 'dummyvar')

                    dataDriven = isdatadrivenhere
                    if(dataDriven == TRUE){
                    df3_analysisidhere <-
                    cards::ard_categorical(
                        data = in_data,
                        strata = c(byvarshere),
                        variables = 'dummy',
                        denominator = denom_dataset
                    ) } else {
                    df3_analysisidhere <-
                    cards::ard_categorical(
                        data = in_data,
                        by = c(byvarshere),
                        variables = 'dummy',
                        denominator = denom_dataset
                    ) }
                    df3_analysisidhere <- df3_analysisidhere|>
                    dplyr::filter(stat_name %in% c('n', 'p')) |>
                    dplyr::mutate(operationid = dplyr::case_when(stat_name == 'n' ~ opid1here,
                                                              stat_name == 'p' ~ opid2here))

parameters.name: distinctlisthere
parameters.description: list of variables by which to apply the "distinct" function from dplyr

parameters.name: denomanaidhere
parameters.description: Analysis ID for Denominator Analysis

parameters.name: denom_anagroupvarshere
parameters.description: Analysis Grouping variables for denominator dataset

parameters.name: isdatadrivenhere
parameters.description: dataDriven boolean value for highest Analysisgrouping factor

parameters.name: byvarshere
parameters.description: variables to be used in "by" or "strata" statement

methods.label: Grouped summary of categorical variable
methods.description: Descriptive summary statistics across groups for a categorical variable, based on subject occurrence

codeTemplate.code:
method_id = 'methodidhere'
if(method_id == 'Mth_01') {
in_data = df2_analysisidhere |>
    select(anavarhere, groupvar1here) |>
    unique()
df3_analysisidhere <-
  ard_categorical(
    data = in_data
    bystmthere
  ) |>
filter(stat_name == 'N') |>
 mutate(operationid = 'Mth_01_01_n')
} else {
denom_dataset = df2_denomanaidhere %>%
  select(denom_anagroupvarshere)
in_data = df2_analysisidhere %>% 
    distinct(distinctlisthere) 
dataDriven = isdatadrivenhere
if(dataDriven == TRUE){
df3_analysisidhere <-
  ard_categorical(
    data = in_data
    stratastmthere,
    denominator = denom_dataset
  ) } else {
df3_analysisidhere <-
  ard_categorical(
    data = in_data
    bystmthere,
    denominator = denom_dataset
  ) }
df3_analysisidhere <- df3_analysisidhere|>
filter(stat_name %in% c('n', 'p')) |>
mutate(operationid = case_when(stat_name == 'n' ~ 'Mth_02_01_n',
                               stat_name == 'p' ~ 'Mth_02_02_%'))
}

parameters.description: Analysis variable to be summarised
parameters.name: anavarhere

parameters.description: Analysis grouping variable from Group1
parameters.name: groupvar1here

parameters.description: list of variables by which to apply the "distinct" function from dplyr
parameters.name: distinctlisthere

parameters.description: Analysis ID for Denominator Analysis
parameters.name: denomanaidhere

parameters.description: Analysis Grouping variables for denominator dataset
parameters.name: denom_anagroupvarshere

parameters.description: dataDriven boolean value for highest Analysisgrouping factor
parameters.name: isdatadrivenhere

parameters.description: variables to be used in "by" statement
parameters.name: byvarshere

parameters.description: All Analysis Grouping Variables, with the last being added to the "variables" argument, and the rest to the "by" argument (seperated with commas, in single quotes, and in a c() list where more than one variable in a list)
parameters.name: bystmthere

parameters.description: All Analysis Grouping Variables, with the last being added to the "variables" argument, and the rest to the "strata" argument (seperated with commas, in single quotes, and in a c() list where more than one variable in a list)
parameters.name: stratastmthere

methods.name: Summary by group of a continuous variable
methods.label: Grouped summary of continuous variable
methods.description: Descriptive summary statistics across groups for a continuous variable

codeTemplate.code:
df3_analysisidhere <-
  ard_continuous(
    data = df2_analysisidhere,
    by = c(byvarshere),
    variables = anavarhere
  ) |>
mutate(operationid = case_when(stat_name == 'N' ~ 'Mth_03_01_n',
                               stat_name == 'mean' ~ 'Mth_03_02_Mean',
                               stat_name == 'sd' ~ 'Mth_03_03_SD',
                               stat_name == 'median' ~ 'Mth_03_04_Median',
                               stat_name == 'p25' ~ 'Mth_03_05_Q1',
                               stat_name == 'p75' ~ 'Mth_03_06_Q3',
                               stat_name == 'min' ~ 'Mth_03_07_Min',
                               stat_name == 'max' ~ 'Mth_03_08_Max'))

parameters.description: string for "by" parameter for the ard_continuous function
parameters.name: byvarshere

parameters.description: Analysis variable to be summarised
parameters.name: anavarhere
